  "description": "Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Manager (Power Plant)

Job Location:&nbsp;Shagamu, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Power Plant &ndash; Electrical
Start Date: Immediate

Job Description


	The Assistant Manager /&nbsp;Officer, Power Plant (Electrical) will be responsible for overseeing daily shift operations and ensuring optimal performance of the power plant&rsquo;s electrical systems and equipment.
	The role requires strong technical competence, hands-on maintenance skills, and the ability to troubleshoot and resolve operational issues efficiently.


Key Responsibilities


	Independently operate and manage daily shift activities of the substation, including overhaul, repair, and troubleshooting of Bergen or Wartsila engines and associated utilities.
	Conduct operation and maintenance of transformers, VCBs, and ACBs.
	Provide technical expertise for electrical equipment including transformers, generators, motors, relays, and cables.
	Operate and troubleshoot DOL starters, star-delta starters, and VFD systems.
	Manage and troubleshoot PCC and MCC systems.
	Develop and implement preventive maintenance schedules for all critical equipment as per OEM guidelines, while ensuring proper documentation and compliance with ISO standards.
	Perform maintenance and repair of all instruments, PLC control systems, and LV, MV &amp; HV switchgears.
	Carry out maintenance and operations of all electrical equipment within the Wartsila power plant and associated facilities
	Utilize computer applications effectively for reporting, monitoring, and documentation.


Salary Range
N350,000 - N500,000 / Month Gross.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruiter9@ascentech.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as subject of the mail.",

        Regus is helping to change the way the World works by leading the Workplace revolution. We are the clear number one player in the rapidly growing, global flexible workplace market. We provide convenient, high-quality workplaces, for any period of time. We are the only provider with significant and growing national networks which provide an unrivalled global reach. We are recruiting to fill the position of:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Reference ID: 47396
Location: Lagos
Employement Type: Full Time (On Site)
Contract Type: Permanent

About the Job


	We are looking for true “hunters” who enjoy the rewards that come from developing new business and consistently achieving targets.


Responsibilities


	The international Workplace Group is the global leader in hybrid working, helping over 8 million people run their businesses in more than 1,000 cities.
	Salespeople are key to our success and are responsible for:
	
		Selling our full range of products and services, closing a deal every day.
		Conducting tours for prospective customers, winning their business to achieve your sales target.
		Showing prospects the benefits of hybrid working to convert them into customers.
	
	


What You’ll Need


	We are looking for a born networker with a natural ability to build relationships with customers.
	You should have/be:
	
		A positive attitude and good energy.
		Self-motivated with drive to achieve sales targets.
		A resilient attitude and the ability to quickly bounce back.
		Strong influencing skills and be able to close deals.
	
	


What We Offer You


	Uncapped commission; the more you sell the more you earn.
	Opportunity to work for the market leader in a growing industry; we regularly have new inventory to sell.
	A fun, challenging and dynamic working environment.
	Award-winning induction training and excellent ongoing learning and development.
	Fantastic promotion prospects: high performers can choose a range of career paths.
	Access to a comprehensive range of flexible, personalised workplace benefits that support mental, physical and financial wellbeing.
	Opportunity to travel and build an international career.

  "title": "Supply Chain Logistics Coordinator",
  "description": "Uniterm Nigeria Limited was incorporated in 2004. It has grown rapidly with professional staff of about 200 delivering quality and cost effective services in the Oil &amp; Gas sector of the Nigerian economy. Uniterm is a Nigerian Company owned by Nigerians. The workforce is made up of professionals drawn across the world.

Uniterm is under the management of highly technical personnel with combined experience level of 150 years. Uniterm is a member of International Association of Drilling Contractors (IADC) and the management staff are members of various professional bodies around the world. Uniterm has offices in Portharcourt and Lagos Nigeria, Houston in USA and Calgary in Canada. Uniterm has key Technical Partners in order to continue to use state-of-the-art technology to deliver services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Chain Logistics Coordinator

Job Location:&nbsp;Rivers
Employment Type: Full Time&nbsp;

Job Description


	Monitor and execute the secure, un-damaged movement of all international imported &amp; exported goods via Air, Sea, and Land, as well as local transport&rsquo;s to and from regional hubs to dispatch locations for the offshore rigs.
	Ensure all required logistics, customs and excise documentation is accurate and processed in line with local and international requirements.
	Oversee the storage and movement of materials to, from and at local warehouses and yards in compliance with Company policies and procedures.


Key Responsibilities
Regulatory &amp; Corporate Compliance:&nbsp;


	Prepare and ensure all import-export clearance instructions are issued to the Company&rsquo;s Third-Party Logistics (3PL) Providers in a timely and accurate manner.&nbsp;
	Oversee performance of 3PL&rsquo;s to ensure agreed service level is maintained and resolve or escalate any performance issues to support management.&nbsp;
	Responsible for identifying and/or validating Export Control Classification Number (ECCN) for all export or re-export materials as requested or upon receipt at 3PL provider via Material Receipt OS&amp;D (Overage, Shortage and Damage).&nbsp;
	Ensure that safe and good environmental practices are promoted on a continual basis.&nbsp;
	Maintain good housekeeping in areas of responsibility and ensure all materials are stored and moved around site safely and in compliance with Company policies.&nbsp;
	Actively contribute to continuous improvement of Company&rsquo;s Logistics and Customs processes and policies.&nbsp;
	Administer and maintain customs and other relevant documentation to ensure all statutory regulations are adhered to in the movement and reporting of materials.&nbsp;
	Populate, maintain export compliance classification archive capturing HTSUS / Schedule (Harmonised Tariff).&nbsp;
	Schedule of the US, B/ECCN/License/License (Schedule B &ndash; Export Control Classification Number) exceptions, etc., for future catalogue inclusion by material master number.&nbsp;
	Assist with export control documentation as it relates to Purchaser and Supplier Certification requirements.


Operations:&nbsp;


	Maintain rig shipping profiles (RSP) in partnership with assigned freight forwarder&nbsp;
	Ensure all material and packing reports are prepared and reviewed in a timely manner to meet designated shipping schedules.&nbsp;
	Monitor shipments at docks, airport, or other location when necessary to ensure timely arrival / delivery&nbsp;
	Create, issue and receipt Transport Orders within Company ERP system.&nbsp;
	Obtain quotes for domestic and international air and sea freight estimates.&nbsp;
	Coordinate booking for air, sea, and land cargo and ensure movement of materials is done in a safe, efficient, and timely manner in accordance with Company&rsquo;s Standard Operating Procedure and the contracts and agreements in place with the respective rig clients
	Manage and maintain regional warehousing and storage of company stock, ensuring all materials are stored in such a way as to prevent damage or deterioration in accordance with company policies and procedures and industry standards.&nbsp;
	Action request for identification details on materials (photos, serial numbers etc) as requested.&nbsp;
	Manage backloads from regions rigs and ensure these are actioned in a timely manner (with assistance from Supply Chain personnel as required) and actioned on Company ERP system as required.&nbsp;
	Expedite and coordinate emergency or rig down orders from seller to packer and/or port of export.&nbsp;
	Verify and check commercial invoices, BOL, AWB, export and entry documentation&nbsp;
	Verify all customs import entries against clearance instructions and confirm customs status and commodity codes for all international items with vendor&nbsp;
	Identify, document, and follow up on Shortage and Damage of materials.&nbsp;
	Arrange permission and execute to scrap items in line with company policy.&nbsp;
	Provide management and statutory reports as requested&nbsp;
	Perform other duties, complete additional tasks, and support ad hoc projects as required.


Storage facilities:&nbsp;


	Conduct stock checks on material held in Company storage facilities.&nbsp;
	Support Supply Chain colleagues with audit and inventory stock takes.&nbsp;
	Manage and maintain regional warehousing and storage of company stock, ensuring all materials are stored in such a way as to prevent damage or deterioration in accordance with company policies and procedures and industry standards.&nbsp;


Emergency Response:&nbsp;


	Understands and is competent to carry out responsibilities as described in the emergency response procedure.&nbsp;
	Comply with and contribute to office emergency response procedures


&nbsp;Personnel &amp; Training:&nbsp;


	Take personal responsibility for own continued professional development and undertake any training as required.&nbsp;
	Responsible for ensuring own certificates if required for trade or position are kept valid and current.


Quality, Health, Safety &amp; Environment:

	Adhere to all policies, procedures, regulations, and standards established by the organization and relevant authorities.&nbsp;
	You have the responsibility and obligation to &ldquo;stop&rdquo; any task, condition or behaviour that appears to be unsafe.&nbsp;
	Participate in QHSE training and awareness programs provided by the organization.&nbsp;

	Familiarize yourself with emergency procedures and protocols to respond effectively in case of emergencies such as fires, spills, or medical emergencies.&nbsp;
	Promptly report any accidents, incidents, occupational illnesses and near misses to your Line Manager.&nbsp;
	Use provided plant, machinery and work equipment (including PPE) correctly and in accordance with established procedures, training or instruction provided by the organization. Report any defects or issues with the equipment to your Line Manager.
